description: Enables the APNs sandbox channel for an application or updates the status and settings of the APNs sandbox channel for an application.

parameters.name: APNSSandboxChannelRequest
parameters.description: Specifies the status and settings of the APNs (Apple Push Notification service) sandbox channel for an application. BundleId (string) --- The bundle identifier that's assigned to your iOS app. This identifier is used for APNs tokens. Certificate (string) --- The APNs client certificate that you received from Apple, if you want Amazon Pinpoint to communicate with the APNs sandbox environment by using an APNs certificate. DefaultAuthenticationMethod (string) --- The default authentication method that you want Amazon Pinpoint to use when authenticating with the APNs sandbox environment, key or certificate. Enabled (boolean) --- Specifies whether to enable the APNs sandbox channel for the application. PrivateKey (string) --- The private key for the APNs client certificate that you want Amazon Pinpoint to use to communicate with the APNs sandbox environment. TeamId (string) --- The identifier that's assigned to your Apple developer account team. TokenKey (string) --- The authentication key to use for APNs tokens. TokenKeyId (string) --- The key identifier that's assigned to your APNs signing key, if you want Amazon Pinpoint to communicate with the APNs sandbox environment by using APNs tokens.

nested_params.name: BundleId
nested_params.description: The bundle identifier that's assigned to your iOS app. This identifier is used for APNs tokens.

nested_params.name: Certificate
nested_params.description: The APNs client certificate that you received from Apple, if you want Amazon Pinpoint to communicate with the APNs sandbox environment by using an APNs certificate.

nested_params.name: DefaultAuthenticationMethod
nested_params.description: The default authentication method that you want Amazon Pinpoint to use when authenticating with the APNs sandbox environment, key or certificate.

nested_params.name: Enabled
nested_params.description: Specifies whether to enable the APNs sandbox channel for the application.

nested_params.name: PrivateKey
nested_params.description: The private key for the APNs client certificate that you want Amazon Pinpoint to use to communicate with the APNs sandbox environment.

nested_params.name: TeamId
nested_params.description: The identifier that's assigned to your Apple developer account team. This identifier is used for APNs tokens.

nested_params.name: TokenKey
nested_params.description: The authentication key to use for APNs tokens.

nested_params.name: TokenKeyId
nested_params.description: The key identifier that's assigned to your APNs signing key, if you want Amazon Pinpoint to communicate with the APNs sandbox environment by using APNs tokens.

parameters.name: ApplicationId
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the application. This identifier is displayed as the Project ID on the Amazon Pinpoint console.

nested_items.name: APNSSandboxChannelResponse
nested_items.description: Provides information about the status and settings of the APNs (Apple Push Notification service) sandbox channel for an application.

nested_items.name: ApplicationId
nested_items.description: The unique identifier for the application that the APNs sandbox channel applies to.

nested_items.name: CreationDate
nested_items.description: The date and time when the APNs sandbox channel was enabled.

nested_items.name: DefaultAuthenticationMethod
nested_items.description: The default authentication method that Amazon Pinpoint uses to authenticate with the APNs sandbox environment for this channel, key or certificate.

nested_items.name: Enabled
nested_items.description: Specifies whether the APNs sandbox channel is enabled for the application.

nested_items.name: HasCredential
nested_items.description: (Not used) This property is retained only for backward compatibility.

nested_items.name: HasTokenKey
nested_items.description: Specifies whether the APNs sandbox channel is configured to communicate with APNs by using APNs tokens. To provide an authentication key for APNs tokens, set the TokenKey property of the channel.

nested_items.name: Id
nested_items.description: (Deprecated) An identifier for the APNs sandbox channel. This property is retained only for backward compatibility.

nested_items.name: IsArchived
nested_items.description: Specifies whether the APNs sandbox channel is archived.

nested_items.name: LastModifiedBy
nested_items.description: The user who last modified the APNs sandbox channel.

nested_items.name: LastModifiedDate
nested_items.description: The date and time when the APNs sandbox channel was last modified.

nested_items.name: Platform
nested_items.description: The type of messaging or notification platform for the channel. For the APNs sandbox channel, this value is APNS_SANDBOX.

nested_items.name: Version
nested_items.description: The current version of the APNs sandbox channel.
